description: Completion of 2 four-hour lab experiments with oral assessment of preparation, participation, and written records. Evaluates understanding of physical principles, experimental results, analysis, and lab book presentation.
Individual assignment based on course materials from the first half of the term. Focuses on analysis of structural, thermal, and electronic properties of solids.
8 in-person quizzes (10 minutes each) during lectures, testing previous week's content. Best 6 of 8 marks count. Permits handwritten notes/printed slides; no digital devices or collaboration.
20-minute oral exam covering all course material (excluding labs). Includes 4 pre-released questions requiring explanations, equation writing, and diagrams. Follow-up questions and recording occur.
